description: From Latin superērogātōrius (“supererogatory”), from superērogātiō (“payment in addition”), from superērogō (“pay out over and above”), from super (“above”) + ērogō (“pay out, expend”); from ex (“out of, from”) + rogō (“ask; request”).

adjectives.description: supererogatory (comparative more supererogatory, superlative most supererogatory)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to supererogation; doing more than is required, especially with reference to good works in Roman Catholicism
